title: Thursday Afternoon Business Brief
text:
October 8, 2015, 1:22 PM NEW YORK - 
The stock market is feeling mixed. At 2:05 p.m. Eastern, the Dow industrials had risen 36 points, the Nasdaq was down 25 points, and the S&P was up two points. WASHINGTON (AP) - Federal Reserve officials were almost ready to raise interest rates in September but held off because of China's economic slowdown and its potential to derail U.S. growth and inflation. Minutes of the Sept. 16-17 discussions showed the central bank believed the time for the first Fed rate increase in nine years "might be near," but decided to wait. WASHINGTON (AP) - Volkswagen is looking at compensating owners of diesel-powered cars that have devices set up to cheat on U.S. emissions tests. U.S. CEO Michael Horn tells lawmakers the company may pay customers for a loss in resale values. Horn says VW doesn't know how much the cheating will cost it. WASHINGTON (AP) - The risk of fire is prompting federal officials to back a proposed ban on rechargeable lithium battery shipments as cargo on passenger airlines. An FAA official cited research showing the batteries can cause explosions and fires capable of destroying a plane. NEW YORK (AP) - Like it or not, Facebook is considering something new. It's called "Reactions," and is meant for users for whom simply "liking" something isn't enough. The social network is testing out buttons that represent the emotions of "love,"''yay,"''ha ha,"''wow,"''angry" and "sad" in Ireland and Spain. Â© 2015 Associated Press. All rights reserved.
